intro: Tutcheria ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf tutcheria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with ovate leaflets and produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
